lead_paragraph: SWEENEY--Anne J. 85, passed away in Los Angeles on Friday, December 11, 2015. She was preceded in death by her adoring husband, Donald E. Sweeney, Sr., and her brothers, James (in infancy), Thomas, James, William, and Edward, and her sisters Claire Rose Taber and Marie Becker. She was born on March 1, 1930, in Wilkes-Barre, PA to James J. and Marie O'Connell Tormay. She moved to Onondoga Hill in Syracuse, NY in 1939. She was a communicant of St. Michael's Church in Syracuse. She received her Bachelor of Science degree from the State University of New York Teacher's College at Oswego in 1951, where she was President of the Newman Club. Her great passion in life was teaching and her favorite people were children. She completed her student teaching in Baldwinsville, NY and began her formal career in Liverpool. She moved to the Hudson Valley in the mid fifties and taught in Hudson, NY, and later in the Kingston Consolidated School District for 18 years. She taught second grade at both the Elisha M. Brigham Elementary School and Chambers Elementary School. Her students will remember her ability to do all of the voices when reading "Charlotte's Web" aloud to the class, lessons in "SC" (self control) and her mantra, "Life is Choices." She also taught evening adult education with her husband at John F. Kennedy Elementary School and was CCD instructor at St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church in Kingston, NY, where she also served as a Eucharistic Minister. She is survived by her three children, Anne M. Sweeney and her husband Philip H. Miller of Los Angeles, Donald E. Sweeney of Kingston, and Rosemary Sweeney Hanczor and her husband, Robert Hanczor of San Diego. She also leaves seven adoring grandchildren - Christopher and Rosemary Miller, Michaela and Shelagh Sweeney, and Catherine, Elizabeth and Brigid Hanczor, as well as a cousin, Rita Tormay of Yonkers, NY and many nieces and nephews. A Funeral Mass was held on December 16 at St. Monica's Catholic Church in Santa Monica, CA, followed by a burial service at Holy Cross Cemetery in Culver City, CA. Donations can be made to the Donald E. and Anne J. Sweeney Memorial Scholarship Fund, St Monica Catholic Schools, 1030 Lincoln Blvd., Santa Monica, CA 90043. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  SWEENEY, ANNE J
